title: A Hell of a Shift
subtitle: Point-and-Click | Work Simulator | Puzzles | Game Studio
content: Point-and-Click | Work Simulator | Puzzles | Game Studio
description: A 2D point-and-click narrative driven, puzzle solving game made using Unity and C#. Play as an intern who freshly joined the game development studio and complete tasks to progress your career. Keep your pressure gauge in check to survive the game or get "fired". This work simulator has a deep secret associated with it, can you figure it out?

highlights.name: Pressure System
highlights.detail: The health system of the game which is affected by your ability to solve tasks and their accuracy.

highlights.name: Drag and Drop
highlights.detail: Main mechanic used in all puzzles of the game.

highlights.name: Complex UI System
highlights.detail: An entire complex system of UI screens working in sync across various systems.

highlights.name: Dialogue System
highlights.detail: A branched out with options dialogue system disguised in form of email system in game.

highlights.name: Advanced Event Bus
highlights.detail: An event bus firing different types of events along with a trigger point in game.

highlights.name: Data Handling
highlights.detail: An ecosystem of scriptable objects to handle all kinds of data ranging from characters, dialogues, tasks, events, puzzles.

roles: Functioned as the Core Programmer in a team of 4
Helped design systems of the game
Worked as the Producer of the team maintaining a JIRA board for tasks and communicating with team members regarding them
details: The main objective of the player would become a full-time developer at the company. They will start at the company as an Intern but by completing the tasks well and on time, will gain experience to get promoted to a junior position. Which they'll have to continue their work journey with more responsibilities and tasks to eventually reach the full developer position. Though this is the general narrative for the game there is a secondary narrative that is around the setting of the game being in hell, in which the player must complete the task well to be turned into a demon and live a normal life in hell or be sent to the pits of hell to be tortured. This is showcased via the art style and subtle hints in the writing.
